lead_paragraph: Maung Saungkha, who wrote that he had a tattoo of the country’s president on his penis, was sentenced to six months in jail and released for time served.

byline.contributor: Austin Ramzy reported from Hong Kong, and Wai Moe from Chiang Mai, Thailand.
byline.original: By AUSTIN RAMZY and WAI MOE

headline.print_headline: Poem About a Very Private Tattoo Brings a Conviction in Myanmar
headline.main: Myanmar Poet Who Wrote of Penis Tattoo Is Convicted of Defaming Ex-Leader

snippet: Maung Saungkha, who wrote that he had a tattoo of the country’s president on his penis, was sentenced to six months in jail and released for time served.
abstract: Maung Saungkha, poet in Myanmar jailed since November for writing short poem asserting he has tattoo of country's president on his penis, is found guilty of defamation, sentenced to six months in prison and released according to time already served.
